OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with tingling pain in the sole of the right foot, especially upon elevation and during exercise, with a significant history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and smoking.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 6-week history of tingling pain in the sole of his right foot, which worsens when he raises it above chest level during exercises. He mentions that he began exercising regularly 2 months ago and experiences right calf cramps with the use of the treadmill's incline feature, necessitating frequent breaks. The pain subsides completely after a few minutes of resting. He adds an 8-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Tingling pain in the sole of the right foot upon elevation

Patient_Actor.Social_History: Smokes two packs of cigarettes daily for 34 years.

Neurovascular_Examination.Straight_Leg_Raise_Test: Elicits pallor and tingling pain in the right foot.
Neurovascular_Examination.Pulses: Femoral pulses are palpable; right pedal pulses are absent.
Neurovascular_Examination.Sensation: No alterations noted besides tingling on straight leg raise.

Doppler_Ultrasound_Imaging_of_the_Right_.Findings: Evidence of significant femoropopliteal artery stenosis in the right leg.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a 55-year-old man presenting with foot pain and cramping during exercise, and diagnose the underlying condition.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing tingling pain in the sole of his right foot for the last 6 weeks, which occurs when he raises his foot above chest level during exercises. He started exercising regularly 2 months ago and notices his right calf cramps when using the incline feature on his treadmill, requiring him to stop frequently. The pain subsides after a few minutes of rest. He has been managing type 2 diabetes mellitus for 8 years. He is a smoker with a 34-year history of smoking two packs per day.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Tingling pain in the sole of the right foot during exercise
Secondary_Symptoms: Right calf cramps with incline exercise

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed with metformin for the past 8 years.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Smoking history of two packs per day for 34 years.

Neurovascular_Examination.Straight_Leg_Raise_Test: Induces pallor and tingling pain in the right foot, without back pain
Neurovascular_Examination.Pulses: Femoral pulses palpable, right pedal pulses absent

Ankle-Brachial_Index.Right: Reduced, indicative of peripheral artery disease

Doppler_Ultrasound_Right_Lower_Extremity.Findings: Reduced blood flow and stenosis in the femoropopliteal artery segment
